I don't usually write a review for a game, but the epic end credits brought me here. Everything is just fabulous, the experience with this game is totally worth it. The plot is amazing, and the characters are also well developed as well. Ah and did I told you the voice lines are impressive af, and they are very hilarious, the GlaDOS, Wheatley and yeah... the Space Sphere. Anyway, that's all I can say, nicely done Valve :>

I already like puzzle games (although I'm not always good at them) so playing Portal 2 was a lot of fun. Sometimes I had to look up how to solve one, but that's okay.
The soundtrack is really good, I love it. And the story is nice too. I love the humor and the little plot twists they created. I didn't play it 100% blind because I've already seen some videos before I played it myself but it was still a very nice experience.

I haven't played the CO-OP yet but I'll plan to do that someday.

I've seen and heard all the praise for this game before I was able to play it. They all said it was better than the first. Thankfully though, I've seen Yahtzee's review of this game saying that the first one was better. His review lowered my expectations for this game for me to fully enjoy it and I must say that this game is better than the first one, story-wise at least. Everything else is on par with the first Portal game.

Portal 2 is a beautiful game with great gameplay and story.
If you havent played it yet: PLAY IT!
keye
游戏宗师

Portal 2 is a First Person Perspective mash of puzzle game and First Person Shooter made abd published by Valve. It is a sequel to acclaimed by critics Portal from 2007. Until now the game was released so far on PC with Windows, Linux and OS X, Playstation 3 and Xbox 360. Maybe it is just my imagination but I think being a real gamer and not hearing at peast once about this franchise is nearly impossible.

The plot continoues story of Chell, our mute protagonist after events of the first Portal is still imprisoned in Aperture's facility, this time however she has a new companion, the AI named Wheatley. During they desperate struggle to escape they accidentaly revive GLaDOS, the AI overseeing the entire project. Once again the villainous machine force us to solve puzzles and proceed through test chambers in order to survive. The story is preety great in my opinion, thanks to side characters that can be funny yet convincing all the time really make you enjoy everything, also it has some shocking plot twists and really satisfying ending.
Just as in previous game Chell is armed with the iconic Portal Gun that can create portals on white surfaces, allowing us to move around on very creative ways. Developers also cared to add some new mechanics including pushing streams and various gels boosting our speed or height of jumps. Turrets, buttons etc. The level design often force us to think over all the movements, the solutions are not always obvious so you can spend even an hour in one chamber just on trying out what works and what not.
Soundtrack is not only enjoyable, but also it reacts to what player does. If you walk on orange gel for example the music speeds up for a while, it really adds some immerse to the gameplay.
The game has it's years so at least on modern PCs you can expect flawless performance, frames does not fall ever below 60 on highest settings, besides graphics still look great.

To be honest this is propably the one of the most intense puzzle games you can find on Steam today, story does not dissapoint, gameplay require a lot of thinking, the music fits great and it is all still enjoyable despite the years. If like me you have grown on classic Tomb Raiders or other games that challenge your way of thinking you will enjoy it so much. 10/10.
